carousel_items: Starts working in one hour and works best if you take it regularly.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how this medicine affects you.
Take Tramadol with food to avoid an upset stomach.
There are different doses for people who are older or who have liver or kidney disease, so work with your doctor to get the right dose.
Swallow the extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly and breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a serious overdose.

basics.benefits_moa: Tramadol is an atypical opioid pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it alters certain brain chemicals to lower pain perception and improve mood.
basics.bottom_line: Tramadol works well to treat severe pain and mood changes. Although it's a little weaker than other opioids, it can still be addictive.
downsides: Some people think it's weaker than other opioid pain medications. It can also cause more upset stomach.

Like other opioid pain relievers, Tramadol has a high risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. It should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment once alternative treatments haven't worked.
It isn't used for short-term, as-needed pain relief.
It's a controlled substance regulated by the federal government. This means that your use of Tramadol will be tracked to prevent potential prescription abuse.
To get Tramadol in the pharmacy, you'll need to bring in a paper prescription directly from your doctor.

downsides_processed.orig: Some people think it's weaker than other opioid pain medications. It can also cause more upset stomach.

Like other opioid pain relievers, Tramadol has a high risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. It should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment once alternative treatments haven't worked.
It isn't used for short-term, as-needed pain relief.
It's a controlled substance regulated by the federal government. This means that your use of Tramadol will be tracked to prevent potential prescription abuse.
To get Tramadol in the pharmacy, you'll need to bring in a paper prescription directly from your doctor.

upsides: Relieves moderate to severe pain. It has been shown to work as well as other opioid pain medications.
Compared to typical opioids, it provides unique pain relief and effects on your mood when taken regularly.
Has a lower chance of causing breathing problems compared to other typical opioids.
Doesn't cause as much constipation as other opioid pain medicines. Staying hydrated and taking laxatives can help treat this side effect.

upsides_processed.orig: Relieves moderate to severe pain. It has been shown to work as well as other opioid pain medications.
Compared to typical opioids, it provides unique pain relief and effects on your mood when taken regularly.
Has a lower chance of causing breathing problems compared to other typical opioids.
Doesn't cause as much constipation as other opioid pain medicines. Staying hydrated and taking laxatives can help treat this side effect.

userStories.tip: caused itching; couldn't sleep
Slows down my digestion enough that I have bloating when I eat sugar or dairy, in addition to opioid induced constipation
nice
Tramadol caused me to faint and cut open my forehead, thus needing medical attention. It also caused the most extreme diarrhea I have ever had in my life. It was awful.
150mg in the morning, then 50mg as needed
It may be addicting for some. It only lasts for 6 hrs. It starts working within a short time. Sometimes it doesn't work; dunno why.
Tramadol is the ONLY medication that has EVER incredibly improved my Depression!!! It acts exactly as an SNRI without the side effects.
Keep in your system daily. ER is best
Don't take caffeine with the drug or within an hour of taking the drug. Caffeine can enhance the side effects (can also make the medicine work faster too, however).
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: Causes drowsiness -- take caution
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: It works well for pain. I noticed if I took regurlarly it stopped working. Best to take it onkly if you have real pain.
worked great for nerve damage pain but side effects made you almost completely unable to feel emotions, you are a robot, use it only if you NEED it badly

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: There was a big problem with tramadol and mental blips. I have stopped it because of mental lapses that were sometimes dangerous.....forgeting stuff on the stove etc. Since stopping I have gotten my mental acuity back.
2 in the morning About 15minutes prior to getting out of bed for a jump-start on the day. 1 in the evening. I stay mostly pain free throughout the day
Take it as prescribed with food.
Taking it regularly allows me to continue to live an active life without the stomach upset of NSAIDS
take one everyday, no problem...50mg. makes me feel better.
userStories.identifier: average, healthy, and out  of shape

userStories.tip: my mom took Tramadol for about 6 weeks and complained constantly that it didn't work. She too 50 mg up to 3 X in 24 hours. When she gave up on the drug she had a terrible nightmare of losing her baby. When I spoke to her she kept saying..
userStories.identifier: 91 yr old advanced arthritis in hip and

userStories.tip: If you are taking tramadol for long term chronic pain, you may need to increase your dose over time as your body "becomes used to it." Talk this over with your doctor.
Warning about serotonin syndrome possibility when mixed antidepressants, triptan type migraine medications and some other opiate medications.
I wished I would of looked at the side effect before taking it. Also that my doctor would of not prescribed for me, because I told him I only had one kidney.
userStories.indication: Moderate to severe pain after surgery

userStories.tip: My feet burn and I'm tired
Thoughts of depression
Causes itching especially at night while trying to sleep

userStories.identifier: single parent and full tim employee

userStories.tip: Vertigo is a small issue when combined with knee replacement.

drugs.name: Tramadol

carousel_items_processed.orig: Starts working in one hour and works best if you take it regularly.
Can make you dizzy or drowsy, so avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how this medicine affects you.
Take Tramadol with food to avoid an upset stomach.
There are different doses for people who are older or who have liver or kidney disease, so work with your doctor to get the right dose.
Swallow the extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly and breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a serious overdose.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Tramadol can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.
risk_factors: Using other medicines that can cause seizures

description_processed.orig: Tramadol can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Use with caution.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: People who are suicidal, at risk for suicide, or prone to addiction should not take Tramadol. People who are depressed or taking antidepressants should be monitored closely by a doctor. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: People who are suicidal, at risk for suicide, or prone to addiction should not take Tramadol. People who are depressed or taking antidepressants should be monitored closely by a doctor. Watch for worsening depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Tramadol with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Go to the hopspital right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Tramadol with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Go to the hopspital right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic (anaphylactoid) reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rare, sudden allergic reactions (including death) can occur, usually after the first dose. Symptoms include difficulty breathing; swelling of the face, tongue, and throat; and itching or hives. This is a medical emergency. People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take the orally disintegrating tablet (Rybix ODT). This formulation contains phenylalanine in an inactive ingredient.
risk_factors: History of allergic reactions to codeine or other opioid pain relievers

description_processed.orig: Rare, sudden allergic reactions (including death) can occur, usually after the first dose. Symptoms include difficulty breathing; swelling of the face, tongue, and throat; and itching or hives. This is a medical emergency. People with sensitivity to phenylketones and phenylalanine should NOT take the orally disintegrating tablet (Rybix ODT). This formulation contains phenylalanine in an inactive ingredient.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Suddenly stopping Tramadol after long periods of use or after high doses can produce withdrawal symptoms, including anxiety, sweating, insomnia, pain, nausea, shaking chills, tremors, diarrhea, nose and throat irritation, raised body hair (piloerection), and hallucinations. Discontinue slowly with the help of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Suddenly stopping Tramadol after long periods of use or after high doses can produce withdrawal symptoms, including anxiety, sweating, insomnia, pain, nausea, shaking chills, tremors, diarrhea, nose and throat irritation, raised body hair (piloerection), and hallucinations. Discontinue slowly with the help of a doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Serious side effects and overdose
risks_warnings.description: Serious side effects may include drug abuse, dependence, slowed breathing rate (respiratory depression), and death. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes or take with alcohol, illegal drugs, or other opioid pain relievers.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: Serious side effects may include drug abuse, dependence, slowed breathing rate (respiratory depression), and death. Don't take more than your doctor prescribes or take with alcohol, illegal drugs, or other opioid pain relievers.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Tramadol lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

description_processed.orig: Tramadol lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Extended-release form
risks_warnings.description: (1) Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Therefore, they should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment, and only if alternative treatments aren't working. They should not be used for as-needed pain relief. (2) Swallow extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly, so breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a lethal overdose.

description_processed.orig: (1) Extended-release and long-acting opioid pain relievers have a greater risk of addiction, abuse, misuse, overdose, and death. Therefore, they should only be used for severe pain that requires daily, around-the-clock treatment, and only if alternative treatments aren't working. They should not be used for as-needed pain relief. (2) Swallow extended-release tablets whole. They're designed to release the drug slowly, so breaking, crushing, or chewing them could cause a lethal overdose.

points.name: Abdominal pain
points.hlt: gastrointestinal and abdominal pains (excl oral and throat)

carousel_items: Take with food to avoid getting diarrhea.
Don't drink alcohol while on Arthrotec.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.
Can cause swelling in the legs, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, and an upset stomach.
Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Arthrotec.
Take Arthrotec at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to lower your risk of a heart attack.
Don't give Arthrotec to anyone that it's not prescribed to, especially women who are pregnant or are trying to become pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Arthrotec contains two medications. Diclofenac stops the body from making chemicals that cause inflammation and pain. Misoprostol protects the stomach from irritation.
basics.bottom_line: Arthrotec is an okay medication used to treat pain and swelling caused by arthritis. However, because of the risk of heart attack, it's recommended to limit the amount you take.
downsides: Can't be used in pregnant or breastfeeding women.
You should avoid alcohol while on Arthrotec since it can increase your risk of stomach issues.
If you're taking it on a regular basis, you'll need to get labs done to make sure your liver and kidneys aren't being affected.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used in pregnant or breastfeeding women.
You should avoid alcohol while on Arthrotec since it can increase your risk of stomach issues.
If you're taking it on a regular basis, you'll need to get labs done to make sure your liver and kidneys aren't being affected.

upsides: Clinical studies show that Arthrotec is better at relieving arthritis pain than acetaminophen (Tylenol).
Can be used as needed to treat pain and swelling.

upsides_processed.orig: Clinical studies show that Arthrotec is better at relieving arthritis pain than acetaminophen (Tylenol).
Can be used as needed to treat pain and swelling.

userStories.tip: Always eat before taking, can upset an empty stomach. Effective on kidney infection pain, and offers partial relief to kidney stone pain

drugs.name: Arthrotec

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid getting diarrhea.
Don't drink alcohol while on Arthrotec.
Don't take other anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDs) without talking to your doctor or pharmacist.
Can cause swelling in the legs, abdominal pain, constipation, diarrhea, and an upset stomach.
Don't take antacids with magnesium since they can interact with Arthrotec.
Take Arthrotec at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to lower your risk of a heart attack.
Don't give Arthrotec to anyone that it's not prescribed to, especially women who are pregnant or are trying to become pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Arthrotec can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Arthrotec during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Arthrotec can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Arthrotec during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Arthrotec can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Arthrotec can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Arthrotec. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Arthrotec. Don't take Arthrotec while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Arthrotec. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Arthrotec. Don't take Arthrotec while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Arthrotec can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Arthrotec and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Arthrotec can cause serious allergic reactions. These reactions can make it difficult to breath or cause a severe rash that can be life-threatening. Stop taking Arthrotec and report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor or get medical help right away.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Arthrotec, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Arthrotec for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Arthrotec, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Arthrotec for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Arthrotec can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Arthrotec can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Arthrotec can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Arthrotec can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.
